medical_history.chief_complaint: Intrauterine growth retardation (IUGR), metaphyseal dysplasia, adrenal hypoplasia congenita, and genital anomalies in patients from a large pedigree.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: All patients were diagnosed during the newborn period. They exhibited severe IUGR and marked postnatal growth failure. Episodes of dehydration with hyponatremia and hyperkalemia occurred in early life, leading to treatment for adrenal insufficiency.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All four patients exhibited variable patterns of adrenal insufficiency, severe IUGR, growth failure, and skeletal changes. One patient had severe scoliosis and marked delayed bone age.
medical_history.family_history: Three affected males and one affected female in the studied pedigree; there is suspicion of affected ancestors with IUGR who died during the neonatal period.
